page.title: 13ARTS AND CRAFTS (CONTINUED)
page.content: {smocking}on them and then she sells them. We have learned to do{smocking}in school. My mum makes{patchwork}quilts. It takes about three years on and off to make. There are thousands of little hexagon pieces of material sewn together. She doesn't sell them so we use them for our own beds. She also makes cushions. My mum is making me a quilt after finishing my sisters. Chedworth W.I.{embroidered}a table cloth for group meeting. All the members made a panel towards it. Each panel had something to do with the W.I., like pots of jam and marmalade, dolls and teddy bears, paints and paintbrushes. The whole cloth took about half a year to make. By Richard Hobart,Rufus Blackwell ,Sally Webber
